channel.title: Posts on Organizing Chaos
channel.description: Recent content in Posts on Organizing Chaos

item.title: Technical debt and conscious decision making
item.description: I joined a podcast with Amir Bormand to discuss technical debt and how to make it useful.

item.title: Spending time wisely
item.description: Getting a lot done is important only when we’re doing the right things

item.title: Overcorrection
item.description: Enable mindset changes by forcing changes to behaviors

item.title: A Rust + WASM development environment with Nix
item.description: Getting started with a new ecosystem can be difficult. Using Nix makes the solution reproducible!

item.title: Enabling constraints
item.description: Constraints don’t always have to make things more difficult

item.title: A few fast solutions for Advent of Code 2023
item.description: How many AOC problems can we solve in under a millisecond?

item.title: Minimize global process
item.description: Global consistency comes at the cost of autonomy; be careful not to stifle what could be your most effective teams

item.title: Software engineering is about thinking, not typing
item.description: Weeks of coding can save you hours of planning

item.title: Simplicity isn't easy
item.description: Simple is the opposite of complex, easy is the opposite of difficult

item.title: Cheat codes
item.description: Support your teams’ decision making processes while giving them the space they need to function autonomously.

item.title: Flexible systems
item.description: Most decisions that you make are not nearly as important as your ability to change them in the future

item.title: Go slow to move fast
item.description: Engineering teams can often improve their long-term development velocity by slowing down in the short term.

item.title: Striped development
item.description: Incremental progress on large projects can be achieved by developing functional stripes across the system’s components.

item.title: Creating a development blog
item.description: Welcome to the inaugural post of Organizing Chaos! I'm the type of person who loves to tinker with new pieces of technology. Recently, I've been experimenting with a few different technical ideas that I thought were worth writing about (stay tuned for future posts ðŸ˜‰), so naturally I started to get excited about the prospect of setting up a personal development blog for myself. After a weekend of research and experimentation, I've arrived at a very simple (yet effective!
